title: KMI Fellowship of Churches multi-page website (branding, Gathering at 6, leadership, appointment request)

requirements.summary: Build the multi-page church website IA with clear navigation and required pages/sections, including a Connect page with explicit placeholders.
acceptanceCriteria: Top-level navigation links exist for each required page/section and work without page reload issues.
All user-facing text is in English and reflects the provided copy (with minimal formatting adjustments allowed for readability).
The Connect page/section includes explicit placeholders for service times, location/contact, live stream/sermons, and social links (even if values are not yet provided).

file_operations.description: Create the app shell with a layout and client-side routing for: Home/Welcome, Who We Are, Our Mission, What to Expect When You Visit, Our Ministries, Community Outreach, Connect With Us, Leadership & Governance, The Gathering at 6, and Schedule a Meeting.
Create a shared layout with header/nav and footer used by all pages; ensure navigation uses client-side links (no full page reload) and includes prominent links to key sections.
Implement top-level navigation entries for each required page/section and provide active-state styling aligned with the brand palette.
Implement the footer with the required palette styling and space for contact/connect information consistent across pages.
Create the Home/Welcome page using the provided copy; include key sections and link-forward CTAs that route to Visit, Connect (Watch Live placeholder), and Schedule a Meeting.
Create the Who We Are page/section content in English, referencing “KMI Fellowship of Churches” and “Elohim’s International Revival Center” where provided in the copy.
Create the Our Mission page/section content in English, reflecting provided copy and consistent section styling.
Create the What to Expect When You Visit page/section; ensure it is linkable for the “Plan Your Visit” CTA.
Create the Our Ministries page/section with readable section structure and placeholder content where details are not provided.
Create the Community Outreach page/section with readable section structure and placeholder content where details are not provided.
Create the Connect With Us page/section including explicit placeholders for service times, location/contact details, live stream/sermons link area, and social media links.

requirements.summary: Add a dedicated “The Gathering at 6” page/section with the provided schedule, location, and What to Expect list.
acceptanceCriteria: A navigation entry leads to a “The Gathering at 6” page/section.
The page/section displays the exact schedule, time, and location details as provided.
The “What to Expect” items are rendered as a readable list.

file_operations.description: Create the “The Gathering at 6” page with title/subtitle, launch date (February 22), recurrence (every second & fourth Sunday), time (6:00 PM), location (13704 NW 150th Place, Alachua, Florida 32616, right next to Alachua Elementary School), and the provided What to Expect bullets as a list.
Wire the “The Gathering at 6” route into the router and ensure the SiteNav includes a navigation link to it.
Add/verify a navigation entry for “The Gathering at 6” and ensure active styling aligns with the brand palette.

requirements.summary: Create a Leadership & Governance page/section with all specified subsections, lists, and the verbatim Accountability & Legal Compliance statement.
acceptanceCriteria: The Leadership & Governance page/section includes each specified subsection and list items.
The Accountability & Legal Compliance statement is displayed verbatim (allowing only minor punctuation/formatting changes).

file_operations.description: Create the Leadership & Governance page including: Presiding Prelate bio header/summary for Dr. Virgil Leo Postell Jr.; Apostolic & Ministerial Governance Structure with Joint Colleges list (Apostles, Prophets, Evangelists, Pastors, Bishops vacant); Schools of Ministry list (Teachers, Ministers); Councils & Assemblies list (Deacons & Deaconesses, Board of Ruling Elders, Joint College of Armor Bearers); Episcopal Positions note (bishops vacant until appointed); Tribunal & Tribunal of Wisdom description; and the Accountability & Legal Compliance statement displayed verbatim.
Wire the Leadership & Governance route into the router and ensure the SiteNav includes a navigation link to it.
Add/verify the Leadership & Governance navigation link and ensure active styling aligns with the brand palette.

requirements.summary: Implement the “Schedule a Meeting with Leadership” appointment request form UI with validation, success state, and React Query submission to the backend capability.
acceptanceCriteria: Client-side validation prevents submission when required fields are missing and when consent is not checked.
The dropdown options match the provided list exactly.
On successful submit, the UI shows a confirmation message and clears or disables the form appropriately.
Submitted requests are persisted in the Motoko canister and can be retrieved via a backend query method (for basic verification/testing).

file_operations.description: Create the appointment request page containing the full field structure (required/optional), dropdown options exactly as provided in the BuildRequest copy, client-side validation, and a clear post-submit success state (confirmation + reset/disable).
Create a React Query mutation hook that calls the backend capability to submit an appointment request; handle loading and error states for user feedback.
Create a React Query query hook to retrieve submitted requests via the backend capability for basic verification/testing (read-only rendering).
Add an optional, minimal read-only UI panel (intended for basic verification/testing) that lists retrieved requests; keep it non-admin-dashboard in scope (no editing/deleting).
Wire the “Schedule a Meeting” route into the router and ensure navigation/CTAs can reach it.

requirements.summary: Add a “Chief Apostle & Prophet Availability” section on the Leadership page with a 3-state legend and calendar-like availability UI plus the confirmation note.
acceptanceCriteria: The availability legend includes all three statuses (Available, Out of Office, Limited Availability).
The note about submission not guaranteeing confirmation is displayed in the section.
A calendar-like UI element is present (it may be static/minimal for initial build, but must visually communicate availability).

file_operations.description: Implement a calendar-like availability UI element (static/minimal) with a legend showing the three statuses (Available, Out of Office, Limited Availability) and include the note that submitting a request does not guarantee an appointment until confirmation is received.
Place the “Chief Apostle & Prophet Availability” section on the Leadership page (next to the bio/photo area) by composing the LeadershipAvailability component.

requirements.summary: Apply the provided brand palette across global UI elements (header/nav, footer, links, buttons) and special sections (scripture/quote blocks, event highlights).
acceptanceCriteria: Primary buttons use #D4AF37 with text #0E2A47 and hover #E25822.
Secondary buttons use #5B2C83 with white text and hover #D4AF37.
Header/navigation uses #0E2A47 with white text and active link accent #D4AF37.
Footer uses #0E2A47 with text #F5F1E8 and accent/icons #D4AF37.
Links default to #0E2A47 and hover to #E25822 (visited may use #5B2C83).
At least one special scripture/quote block style uses #5B2C83 with white text, and an event highlight style uses gold/orange accents.

file_operations.description: Create global styles (Tailwind + shadcn token overrides) to map the brand palette into CSS variables and base elements (body background #F5F1E8, foreground, link styles, and consistent section spacing).

Extend Tailwind theme with named brand colors (Flame Gold #D4AF37, Royal Deep Blue #0E2A47, Revival Fire Orange #E25822, Anointed Purple #5B2C83, Warm Light Neutral #F5F1E8) and ensure utilities exist for buttons/sections/accents.
Apply palette styling to header/nav (deep blue background, white text, gold active accents) and footer (deep blue background, warm neutral text, gold accents) using Tailwind classes.
Create reusable section wrappers/styles (e.g., scripture/quote block using purple + white text; event highlight using gold/orange accents) to ensure consistent special-section styling across pages.
Use the BrandSections helpers to include at least one scripture/quote block and an event highlight style on the Home page.

requirements.summary: Establish a cohesive, modern church-appropriate visual theme with consistent typography, spacing, and section styling using warm neutrals and the provided palette.
acceptanceCriteria: Typography, spacing, and component styling appear consistent across pages (headings, body text, cards/sections, and CTAs).
The overall design uses warm neutrals (#F5F1E8) and avoids introducing unrelated dominant colors that conflict with the provided palette.

file_operations.description: Create lightweight typography wrappers (page title, section title, body text) to standardize type scale and spacing across pages.
Create a consistent section component (padding, max-width, background variants) to enforce a shared spacing system and cohesive layout across pages.
Refactor page structure to use the shared Typography and PageSection components for consistent layout/spacing.

Refactor page structure to use the shared Typography and PageSection components for consistent layout/spacing and consistent form presentation.

requirements.summary: Add primary CTAs that route to Plan Your Visit, Watch Live (placeholder), and Schedule a Meeting.
acceptanceCriteria: “Plan Your Visit” routes the user to the visit/expectations content.
“Schedule a Meeting” routes the user to the appointment request form.
“Watch Live” is present as a CTA and links to a clearly labeled placeholder destination that the user can later edit.

file_operations.description: Create reusable primary CTA buttons/links (Plan Your Visit, Watch Live, Schedule a Meeting) styled with the brand palette and designed for placement in header and Home page.
Add a header CTA area that includes “Plan Your Visit” and “Schedule a Meeting” using the PrimaryCtas component.
Add prominent Home page CTAs using PrimaryCtas and ensure they route to the Visit content, the Connect page placeholder area for Watch Live, and the appointment request form.
Implement a clearly labeled placeholder destination area for “Watch Live” (e.g., a section that indicates where a live stream/sermons link will go) and ensure the CTA scrolls/routes to it.
